channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Trump wants a U.S. wealth fund that surpasses Norway’s. Some Norwegians aren’t sold.
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor
item.description: Trump and the Biden White House both say the United States should have a sovereign wealth fund. Norway, home to the world’s largest, may offer a few lessons.

item.title: Rare Israeli strike on northern Lebanon kills at least 21
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bisset, Lior Soroka

item.title: Live updates: Netanyahu willing to limit counterstrike to Iranian military targets, U.S. officials say
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Leo Sands, Victoria Bisset
item.description: The Israeli prime minister’s words were seen in Washington as a sign of restraint amid concerns that a strike on Iranian oil or nuclear sites could start a wider war.

item.title: Behind the mask: How a soccer star became a cocaine trafficker
item.dc:creator: Kevin Sieff
item.description: A former star player for Ajax Amsterdam and the Netherlands became a major cocaine trafficker and has found refuge in the United Arab Emirates, where he continues to play.

item.title: Sudan’s civil war fueled by secret arms shipments from UAE and Iran
item.dc:creator: Katharine Houreld, Hafiz Haroun
item.description: Despite denials, weapons inspection and confidential assessments reveal that both the Rapid Support Forces and Sudanese military are supported from abroad.

item.title: White House, VP Harris mourn Palestinian American boy on anniversary of his killing in Illinois
item.dc:creator: Mikhail Klimentov

item.title: A frozen human foot found on Mount Everest revives a century-old mystery
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong
item.description: Remains found on Mount Everest may have belonged to the British climber Andrew Comyn “Sandy” Irvine, who disappeared along with George Mallory in 1924.

item.title: U.N. official accuses Israel of ‘atrocities’ after tent shelters set ablaze
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall

item.title: Why North Korea is sending soldiers to the Russian front lines
item.dc:creator: Michelle Lee
item.description: Sending solders to help Russia’s war effort against Ukraine could earn valuable foreign currency for Kim Jong Un’s regime and bolster their strengthening ties.

item.title: Netanyahu tells U.S. that Israel will strike Iranian military instead of oil or nuclear sites, officials say
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Ellen Nakashima

item.title: Israeli strike at Gaza’s al-Aqsa Hospital burns tents, killing at least 4
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Hajar Harb, Claire Parker, Heba Farouk Mahfouz , Rachel Pannett

item.title: Tourist dies trying to climb Spanish bridge for social media content
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett
item.description: The 26-year-old British man died while climbing the roughly 600-foot Castilla-La Mancha bridge, an act local authorities say is prohibited.

item.title: After years of spinning on his head, a breakdancer grew a scalp tumor
item.dc:creator: Kyle Melnick
item.description: Copenhagen neurosurgeons said in a case study that a tumor created a cone-shaped bump atop a breakdancer’s head.

item.title: Israel strikes Gaza’s al-Aqsa Hospital grounds, 200 targets in southern Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Rachel Pannett, Hajar Harb, Annabelle Timsit, Jennifer Hassan, Adam Taylor, Kelsey Baker
item.description: Israel’s military struck what it said was a Hamas command center embedded inside a hospital compound in Deir al-Balah in central Gaza early on Monday.

item.title: Netanyahu tells U.S. that Israel will strike Iranian military, not nuclear or oil, targets, officials say
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Ellen Nakashima
item.description: The signal is being seen in Washington as a sign of restraint after concerns that an Israeli strike on oil or nuclear facilities could trigger a wider war.

item.title: White House, VP Harris mourn Palestinian American boy on anniversary of his killing in Illinois
item.dc:creator: Mikhail Klimentov

item.title: Israeli strike at Gaza’s al-Aqsa Hospital burns tents, killing at least 4
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Hajar Harb, Claire Parker, Heba Farouk Mahfouz
item.description: The Israeli military said it was targeting a Hamas command center. The site was filled with tents erected by families displaced by fighting in the enclave.

item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Ellen Nakashima

item.title: Canada alleges much wider campaign by Modi government against Sikhs
item.dc:creator: Greg Miller, Gerry Shih
item.description: Canada on Monday ordered six Indian diplomats to leave the country, including India’s top diplomat in Ottawa, Sanjay Kumar Verma, officials said.

item.title: What to know about U.S. military support for Israel after a year of war
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor, Leo Sands, Kelly Kasulis Cho, Adela Suliman
item.description: Israel has received more U.S. military aid than any other country since World War II. Here is the assistance it has received since the war in Gaza began.

item.title: Video shows moment Hezbollah rocket hits northern Israel
item.dc:creator: Joe Snell

item.title: What is UNIFIL, the U.N. peacekeeping force in Lebanon?
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall
item.description: The U.N. Interim Force in Lebanon has been patrolling the Israel-Lebanon border for more than 45 years.

item.title: What is UNIFIL, the U.N. peacekeeping force in Lebanon?
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall

item.title: 50 years later, German Stasi agent is convicted of murder, gets 10 years
item.dc:creator: Kate Brady
item.description: The trial, largely based on historical documents and fading memories, underlined the difficulties Germany faces in bringing ex-East German officials to justice.

item.title: The complete list of Nobel Prize winners in 2024
item.dc:creator: Lizette Ortega
item.description: The 2024 Nobel Prize recipients have been announced. See the complete list of laureates and their winning work.

item.title: Israel strikes 200 targets in southern Lebanon, urges residents to evacuate
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan

item.title: China launches large military drills as ‘stern warning’ to Taiwan
item.dc:creator: Katrina Northrop, Vic Chiang
item.description: The Chinese military said the exercises, which will simulate strikes on land and at sea, would serve as “a stern warning” to “Taiwan independence forces.”

item.title: In Iceland, a hunt for Russian submarines and deeper U.S. relations
item.dc:creator: Dan Lamothe
item.description: Iceland, an island nation and NATO member, is wary of Russia’s more aggressive military presence in the waters of the North Atlantic.

item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit

item.title: Meet Ukraine’s top fighting unit — at least that’s what its ad says
item.dc:creator: Lizzie Johnson, Serhii Korolchuk
item.description: Ukraine’s brigades can recruit their own soldiers, and they compete with each other to craft the best advertising campaigns to sell the war.

item.title: Netanyahu warns peacekeepers in Lebanon amid global outrage over attacks on UNIFIL
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan, Alon Rom, Niha Masih

item.title: Is Israel deploying a ‘surrender or starve’ strategy in Gaza?
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: A new phase of the war may be underway, as hopes for a cease-fire and deal to release the remaining hostages in Hamas captivity wane.

item.title: Four Israeli soldiers killed in Hezbollah strike; U.S. to send antimissile system to Israel
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Kelly Kasulis Cho, Jennifer Hassan, Annabelle Timsit, Nick Parker, Kelsey Baker, Praveena Somasundaram
item.description: Four IDF soldiers were killed and dozens were injured Sunday after a Hezbollah drone struck an IDF base in northern Israel, Israeli authorities said.

item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix
item.description: The Israel Defense Forces brought journalists into southwestern Lebanon on Sunday to show what commanders described as extensive militant infrastructure.
